tit.e: Kujo-ryu school (the descendants of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan and a school of Yusoku kojitsu)
Kujo-ryu school (the descendants of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan and a school of Yusoku kojitsu)

sen.j: 九条流（くじょうりゅう）は、藤原北家の中でも藤原師輔の子孫を指す呼称及び同一族に伝えられた有職故実の流派を指す。
sen.e: The Kujo line was the naming of the descendants of FUJIWARA-Hokke, especially, FUJIWARA no Morosuke and was the line which taught the knowledge of court rules, ceremony, decorum, and records of the past to the descendants of FUJIWARA no Morosuke.

The Kujo-ryu school refers to the descendants of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, especially, FUJIWARA no Morosuke and to the school of Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) handed down the FUJIWARA no Morosuke family.

The Kujo-ryu school refers to the descendants of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, especially, FUJIWARA no Morosuke and to the school of Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) handed down the FUJIWARA no Morosuke family.

sen.j: 藤原師輔は関白藤原忠平の次男に生まれ、右大臣にまで昇進したものの兄藤原実頼の存在のために摂政関白になることなく終わった。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Marosuke was the second son of the Kanpaku (a chief adviser of the Emperor) FUJIWARA no Tadahira and he was promoted to Minister of the Right (a government position in Japan in the late Nara and Heian periods); however, he finished his life without being appointed to the Sessho (an assistant for either a child emperor or an empress) Kanpaku (a chief adviser to the Emperor).

FUJIWARA no Morosuke was the second son of the Kanpaku (a chief adviser of the Emperor) FUJIWARA no Tadahira and promoted to Minister of the Right (a government position in Japan in the late Nara and Heian periods), however, he finished his life without being appointed to the Sessho (an assistant for either a child emperor or an empress) or Kanpaku due to the existence of his older brother FUJIWARA no Saneyori.
sen.cmt: スペル修正しました。訳漏れ。「兄藤原実頼の存在のために」を補足しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Morosuke was the second son of the Kanpaku (a chief adviser of the Emperor) FUJIWARA no Tadahira and promoted to Minister of the Right (a government position in Japan in the late Nara and Heian periods), however, he finished his life without being appointed to the Sessho (an assistant for either a child emperor or an empress) or Kanpaku due to the existence of his older brother FUJIWARA no Saneyori.

sen.j: だが、有力政治家の一人として子孫のために『九条年中行事』という朝廷内の礼儀やしきたりを纏めた書物を残した。
sen.e: However, he wrote books called "Kujo-Nenchu-Gyoji" which explained necessities in the Imperial court, as one of the powerful politicians for the sake of descendants.
However, he wrote books called "Kujo nenchugyoji" (Kujo annual events) which explained necessities in the Imperial Court, as one of the powerful politicians for the sake of descendants.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: However, he wrote books called "Kujo nenchugyoji" (Kujo annual events) which explained necessities in the Imperial Court, as one of the powerful politicians for the sake of descendants.

sen.j: 師輔の子孫は女子に恵まれて冷泉天皇から後冷泉天皇までの実に8代にわたる天皇の外戚となって摂政関白の地位を独占した。
sen.e: Descendants of Marosuke were blessed with many girls; thus, the family line monopolized a post of Sessho Kanpaku by becoming maternal relatives of Emperors from the period of the Emperor Reizei to the period of the Emperor Goreizei, covering eight long generations of the Emperor.

Descendants of Morosuke were blessed with many girls; thus, the family line monopolized a post of Sessho Kanpaku by becoming maternal relatives of emperors from the period of the Emperor Reizei to the period of the Emperor Goreizei, covering eight long generations of the emperor.
sen.cmt: スペル、表記を変えました。
sen.e: Descendants of Morosuke were blessed with many girls; thus, the family line monopolized a post of Sessho Kanpaku by becoming maternal relatives of emperors from the period of the Emperor Reizei to the period of the Emperor Goreizei, covering eight long generations of the emperor.

sen.j: 特に藤原道長・藤原頼通父子は前後70年にわたって宮廷政治を支配して摂関政治の全盛期を築た。
sen.e: Especially, FUJIWARA no Michinaga and his son, FUJIWARA no Yorimichi, controlled the court government for 70 years in tandem and built the regency at the height of its prosperity.

sen.j: その子孫は御堂流（みどうりゅう）と呼ばれて代々摂関と藤氏長者の地位を継承した。
sen.e: Their descendants were called the Mido line and succeeded a post of Sekkan (a regent to the Emperor) and Toshi Choja (a head of the Fujiwara clan) for generations.

sen.e: Their descendants were called the Mido-ryu school and succeeded a post of Sekkan (regents and advisers) and Toshi Choja (a head of the Fujiwara clan) for generations.

sen.e: Their descendants were called the Mido-ryu school and succeeded a post of Sekkan (regents and advisers) and Toshi Choja (a head of the Fujiwara clan) for generations.

sen.j: その際に『九条年中行事』に基づいて宮廷儀式を遂行して、しきたりを重視する宮廷社会において他家に対して優位な立場に立つ事を図ったと言う。
sen.e: It is said that they performed the Court ceremony based on "Kujo-Nenchu-Gyoji" and tried to put themselves in a superior position over other clans in the Imperial society which weighed heavily on its convention.
